buyer_research.name: PlayOJO
buyer_research.description: PlayOJO is a UK-based online casino that offers a wide range of games, including slots, blackjack, roulette, and live casino games.
goals: To become the most popular online casino in the UK
To expand its operations to other countries
To increase its revenue and market share

competitors.name: WalkMe
pros: Boost digital adoption at scale with confidence

pains: How will Whatfix help us differentiate ourselves from competitors in the online casino industry?
What kind of ROI can we expect from implementing Whatfix's digital adoption platform?
How will Whatfix integrate with our existing technology stack?
What kind of support does Whatfix offer for issues with the platform?
How will Whatfix help us to increase player engagement and retention?
Can Whatfix provide a customized solution for our specific use cases?
How will Whatfix help us to overcome regulatory challenges in different countries?
What are the security measures in place to protect our player data?
How does Whatfix handle scalability as our business grows?
What kind of analytics and insights will Whatfix provide to help us make data-driven decisions?
objections: We're not sure if Whatfix is the right fit for our online casino business.
We're concerned about the cost of implementing Whatfix's digital adoption platform.
We've had negative experiences with similar platforms in the past.
We're not sure if our employees will be able to use Whatfix effectively.
We're concerned about the potential disruption to our business operations during implementation.
We're not convinced that Whatfix will provide a significant ROI for our business.

messages.content: Hi Ohad, thank you for taking the time to speak with me today. I'm excited to learn more about PlayOJO and how Whatfix can help you achieve your goals. Can you start by telling me a little bit about your current challenges and what you're hoping to accomplish in the next quarter?

Hi, thanks for reaching out. We're facing stiff competition in the online casino industry, and we're struggling to differentiate ourselves. We're also finding it difficult to retain players and increase engagement. We're looking for ways to improve our user experience and stay ahead of the competition.
I understand. It sounds like you're facing some tough challenges. Can you tell me more about your current onboarding process for new players? How are you currently guiding them through your platform?

To be honest, it's a bit of a manual process. We've got a lot of documentation and tutorials, but it's not very engaging. We've also got a support team that answers questions, but it's not very scalable. We're looking for a more automated solution that can help us deliver a better user experience.

That makes sense. Whatfix can definitely help you with that. Our digital adoption platform allows you to create in-app guidance that looks and feels native to your application. We've got a lot of experience working with companies in the gaming industry, and I think we could really help you achieve your goals. Can you tell me more about your technology stack? What platforms and tools are you currently using?

We're using a mix of proprietary and third-party tools. We've got a custom-built platform for our casino games, and we're also using some third-party tools for things like payment processing and customer support.

Okay, that's good to know. We've got a lot of experience integrating with custom-built platforms, and I think we could make it work. Can you tell me more about your goals for player engagement and retention? What kind of metrics are you currently tracking, and what are you hoping to achieve?

We're currently tracking things like time-on-site, bounce rate, and conversion rate. We're hoping to increase all of those metrics by at least 20% in the next quarter. We're also looking to reduce our support queries by at least 30%.

Those are some ambitious goals. I think Whatfix can definitely help you achieve them. We've got a lot of experience working with companies in the gaming industry, and we've got a proven track record of delivering results. Can you tell me more about your decision-making process for this project? Who else is involved in the decision, and what's the timeline for implementation?

The decision-making process will involve our product team, our marketing team, and our IT team. We're hoping to make a decision within the next 6-8 weeks, and we're looking to implement the solution within the next 3-4 months.

Okay, that's good to know. We'll make sure to tailor our proposal to your needs and timeline. Can you tell me more about your budget for this project? Are you looking to allocate a specific amount of resources to this initiative?

We've got a dedicated budget for this project, but I'm not at liberty to disclose the exact amount. Let's just say that we're willing to invest in a solution that can deliver the results we're looking for.

That's completely understandable. We'll make sure to provide a customized proposal that meets your needs and budget. Thank you for taking the time to speak with me today, Ohad. I'll follow up with a summary of our conversation and a proposal within the next 24 hours.

pain_points: stiff competition in the online casino industry
struggling to retain players and increase engagement
manual onboarding process for new players
current onboarding process is not scalable
success_indicators: reduce bounce rate by at least 20%
increase conversion rate by at least 20%
reduce support queries by at least 30%

features.name: Digital Adoption Platform
features.description: A no-code editor to create in-app guidance on any application that looks 100% native, accelerating digital transformation and driving user adoption.

features.name: Product Analytics
features.description: Providing insights to maximize technology investments and achieve business outcomes.

features.name: In-app Guidance
features.description: Offering personalized and contextual guidance to users, increasing engagement and retention.

features.name: User Onboarding
features.description: Streamlining the onboarding process for new players, making it scalable and reducing support queries.

features.name: Performance Support
features.description: Enabling users to get the most out of the platform, increasing time-on-site and conversion rates.

messages.content: Hello everyone, thank you for taking the time to join this demo call today. I'm excited to show you how Whatfix can help address some of the challenges you're facing in the online casino industry. Before we dive in, I just want to briefly review the objectives we discussed during our discovery call. We want to focus on increasing time-on-site by at least 20%, reducing bounce rate by at least 20%, increasing conversion rate by at least 20%, and reducing support queries by at least 30%. Is that correct?
That's right. We're struggling to retain players and increase engagement, and we believe that our current onboarding process is a major contributing factor.

I completely understand. Our User Onboarding feature is designed to streamline the onboarding process for new players, making it scalable and reducing support queries. I'd like to demonstrate how this feature can be customized to fit your specific needs. Let me show you a quick example.

As you can see, our Digital Adoption Platform allows us to create in-app guidance on your application, making it easy for new players to navigate your platform and reducing the need for manual intervention. We can also provide personalized and contextual guidance to users, increasing engagement and retention through our In-app Guidance feature.
That's really impressive. But how do we ensure that our players are getting the most out of our platform?

That's where our Performance Support feature comes in. We can enable users to get the most out of your platform, increasing time-on-site and conversion rates. We've seen great success with this feature in the gaming industry, and I'd love to share some case studies with you later in the call.
We're interested in hearing more about those case studies. Can you tell us more about how Whatfix has helped similar companies in the industry?

Absolutely. One of our clients in the gaming industry saw a 30% increase in time-on-site and a 25% increase in conversion rates after implementing our Performance Support feature. We've also seen a significant reduction in support queries for many of our clients.
That sounds great, but we're concerned about the integration process. How long will it take to implement Whatfix, and what kind of resources will we need to allocate?

I completely understand your concerns. Our implementation process typically takes around 6-8 weeks, and we'll work closely with your team to ensure a seamless integration. We'll also provide you with a dedicated customer success manager to support you throughout the process.
Okay, that sounds reasonable. But what about customization? We have some specific requirements that aren't covered by your existing features.

We understand that every company is unique, and we're happy to customize our features to fit your specific needs. We can work with you to develop a customized solution that addresses your pain points and objectives.

Before we wrap up, I just want to clarify that we'll be following up with some additional assets, including a presentation and a video, to provide more information on our features and case studies. Are there any other questions or concerns you'd like to address before we move forward?
No, I think that covers everything. Thank you for the demo and for addressing our concerns. We'll be in touch soon to discuss next steps.
You're welcome! It was a pleasure demonstrating Whatfix for you today. We're looking forward to the opportunity to work with you and help you achieve your objectives. Have a great day!

messages.content: Hi everyone, thanks for taking the time to discuss pricing for our solution. I wanted to start by summarizing the key points we discussed during the demo. We believe our platform can help you address the pain points we discussed, including stiff competition, difficulty in differentiating, and struggling to retain players and increase engagement.
Yes, that's correct. We're excited about the potential of your platform. Can you walk us through your pricing models?

Absolutely. We have three pricing models to choose from. Our first model is a Flat Fee + User License Fees. This model is customized based on the application and users, and the pricing is yearly or monthly. We also have a Free Plan, which is suitable for small-scale use and comes with 30 credits. Lastly, we have a Basic Plan, which starts at $39 per month and is suitable for small-scale use.
We're interested in the Flat Fee + User License Fees model. Can you explain how that works?

Of course. The flat fee is a one-time payment for the application, and the user license fees are based on the number of users. We can work with you to determine the best fit for your needs. We've found that this model provides the most flexibility and cost savings for our clients.
That sounds good, but we're concerned about the integration process and the resources required. Can you address those concerns?

I completely understand. Our implementation process typically takes around 6-8 weeks, and we'll work closely with your team to ensure a seamless integration. We'll also provide you with a dedicated customer success manager to support you throughout the process. We've had great success with similar clients in the gaming industry.
Okay, that sounds more manageable. What's the budget looking like for this project?

Based on our previous discussions, I believe we can work within your budget constraints. We can provide a customized plan that fits your needs and provides a strong ROI. Our goal is to help you achieve your objectives, including increasing time-on-site by at least 20%, reducing bounce rate by at least 20%, and increasing conversion rate by at least 20%.
We're looking to implement this solution within the next quarter. Is that feasible?
Yes, that's definitely possible. We can work with your team to ensure a smooth implementation within your desired timeline.
We're interested in the Flat Fee + User License Fees model, but we're also considering a yearly subscription. Can you provide more information on that?

We can definitely work with you on a yearly subscription. In fact, many of our clients prefer this model because it provides more cost savings in the long run. We can work out a customized plan that fits your needs and provides a strong ROI.

Our Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure success include increasing time-on-site, reducing bounce rate, and increasing conversion rate. Can you speak to how your platform can help us achieve those objectives?

Absolutely. Our platform is designed to help clients achieve those exact objectives. We've seen significant success with our clients in the gaming industry, including a 30% increase in time-on-site and a 25% increase in conversion rates. We're confident that our platform can help you achieve your objectives.
Our company's financial priorities include maximizing revenue and reducing costs. Can you speak to how your platform can help us achieve those priorities?

Yes, of course. Our platform is designed to help clients maximize revenue and reduce costs. We've seen significant ROI with our clients, and we're confident that our platform can help you achieve your financial priorities.

Before we move forward, I just wanted to summarize the key points we discussed today. We believe our platform can help you address your pain points and achieve your objectives, including increasing time-on-site, reducing bounce rate, and increasing conversion rate. We're confident that our Flat Fee + User License Fees model is the best fit for your needs, and we're willing to work with you to provide a customized plan that fits your budget constraints and provides a strong ROI.
That sounds great. We're interested in moving forward with the next steps. What's the process looking like from here?

We'll send over a customized proposal outlining the scope of work, pricing, and implementation timeline. From there, we can finalize the agreement and begin implementation. We're excited about the potential of working together and helping you achieve your objectives.

preferred_pricing_models: Flat Fee + User License Fees model

negotiation_tactics: providing a dedicated customer success manager
historical_case_studies: similar clients in the gaming industry

messages.content: Hi, thank you for taking the time to discuss the proposal for implementing Whatfix's solutions at PlayOJO. I understand that we've had previous discussions, and I'm excited to address any remaining concerns you may have.

Hi, yes, we're still very interested in Whatfix's solutions, but we do have some concerns about the integration process and the resources required. Can you walk us through how you plan to address these concerns?

Absolutely. I understand that integration is a critical step in the implementation process. Our team will work closely with your IT team to ensure a seamless integration. We've developed a customized plan to minimize the resources required from your side, and we'll provide a dedicated customer success manager to support you throughout the process. We've seen this approach work successfully with similar clients in the gaming industry.
That sounds great, but we're still concerned about the costs associated with the integration. Can you provide some flexibility in your pricing model to accommodate our budget constraints?

I understand that budget constraints are a top priority for PlayOJO. We're willing to offer a customized pricing plan that includes a flat fee plus user license fees, which will provide you with a predictable cost structure. Additionally, we can offer a discount of 10% on the total cost if you're willing to commit to a yearly subscription. We're confident that our solution will provide a significant return on investment, and we're willing to work with you to ensure that it fits within your budget.
That sounds like a good compromise. Who else is involved in the decision-making process, and what's the timeline for implementation looking like?

From what I understand, the key decision-makers involved in the final decision are the product team, marketing team, and IT team. We're willing to work with all stakeholders to ensure that everyone is aligned on the implementation plan. In terms of timelines, we're looking at implementation within the next 6-8 weeks, which aligns with your goal of seeing results within the next quarter.
That sounds like a good plan. We do have some standard contract terms and procurement concerns that we need to address. Can you review and sign off on our contract terms?

I'd be happy to review and sign off on your contract terms. We're willing to work with you to address any procurement concerns you may have. If there are any areas where we need to make adjustments, we'll work together to find a mutually beneficial solution.
Great, I think we've covered all our concerns. What's the next step in the process?

The next step would be to finalize the contract terms and procurement agreements. Once that's done, we'll begin the implementation process, and our team will work closely with your stakeholders to ensure a successful rollout. We're excited about the opportunity to work with PlayOJO and look forward to seeing the results of our collaboration.

objection_handling: addressed integration process and resources required concerns
stakeholder_consensus: Whatfix worked to understand PlayOJO's pain points and objectives
Whatfix emphasized the potential of their platform to achieve PlayOJO's objectives
contract_procurement: customized proposal outlining scope of work, pricing, and implementation timeline
closing_tactics: summarizing key points and reiterating value proposition
outlining next steps and process for moving forward
